> Tucson unsuspectedly sets up a two way com link between what's happening=
 within his radius and the Ark. He sends a text message back to Kup and Lor=
d Elder.
>
> " So far so good. Mild suspicion but nothing significant yet. =
I think they're buying into him. When they go, and are well out of range, t=
ell me, and I'll return inside the Ark. Night Shift's doing his part, now i=
t's my turn to do mine."
>
> He pauses between text messages.
>
> " By the =
way, be ready to light our darkest hour. It's time."
>
> For once, all the =
reservations, apprehensions and anxieties Tucson had were all melting away.=
 He realized that there was no going back to trying to correct the mistakes=
 which he thought were already made, but it was time to step forward and le=
ave new legacies and bring new hope to those who need it badly. It was time=
 to step up to the plate and accept destiny for what it was and not as he t=
hought it should have been. The Matrix had once asked him what his self wor=
th was. And now, he could see it. He was worth a great deal. Not just as a =
warrior but as an innovator, and a new light of hope for all Maximal, and A=
utobot kind. Things did happen along the way, which he thought he could con=
troll, but now as he lies motionless, he realizes that some times not all s=
ituations can be handled without some degree of difficulty. There would be =
hard times, and Chaos was the balance between Harmony and insanity. Without=
 it there wouldn't be a planet to protect and a universe to save. He sends =
one more message to Lord Elder.
>
> " I believe I owe another visit to Opti=
mus Prime. The Matrix may be expecting me."
